programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 27 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Xander Dickson joins the show! Xander talks about him and Shelly's special relationship, and what they need to do to take down the Outlaws this weekend. War at the shore took place this past weekend, and special guest Matty Nestler breaks it all down. The archers had a rough showing this past weekend, and Ky the goalie is not happy about it. Doogs updated his who should the MVP should've been, and the fellas breakdown the funniest Start Bench Cut of the year.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #6: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Masashi Oya is the chip leader ahead of Matthew Wantman, Justin Saliba, Martin Zamani, Jared Jaffee, Ken Aldridge, Anthony Hu, Jesse Lonis, and Dan Shak, as the final nine players play for the $223,100 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The WSOP Main Event plays down to the final table as former champion Dan Harrington, along with Dutchman Marcel Luske look to make a run at being one of the final nine. Plenty of others will fall short, but who will reach the 2004 WSOP Main Event final table?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The final table of the 2004 WSOP Main Event sees Greg Raymer hold the chip lead ahead of Matt Dean, Josh Arieh, Glenn Hughes, Dan Harrington, David Williams, Al Krux, Mike McLain, and Mattias Andersson. All eyes are on the $5 million first-place pirze and the title of 2004 World Champion.

The WSOP bracelet and $221,000 first-place prize would look to be claimed by a savvy group of final tablists that included Marcel Luske, Jeff Lisandro, Joe Awada, Cory Zeidman, Dewey Tomko and John Juanda.

programme.desc: A magnetic playboy with bad intentions manages to date three sisters and uses his charms to convince their unsuspecting mother that he is a good guy.

programme.desc: After serving a prison sentence, farmer Matt Calder (Robert Mitchum) returns to his 19th-century Pacific Northwest gold rush town and retrieves his adolescent son, Mark (Tommy Rettig). Meanwhile, goodhearted barroom singer Kay (Marilyn Monroe) is heading downriver with her boyfriend, Harry (Rory Calhoun), to explore a potential gold claim. When their raft sinks, Harry robs Matt of his gun and horse to continue without Kay on land. Sailing downriver toward the claim, the trio plan their revenge.

programme.desc: An empty stagecoach prompts Gene to investigate a recent mine disaster.

However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: Badman's Territory
programme.desc: After Jesse and Frank James rob a bank in a northern Texas country, Sheriff Mark Rowley (Randolph Scott) and his deputy brother Johnny (James Warren) pursue them into the "Badlands" territory, an outlaw haven not associated with any government. The James brothers are also wanted by a devious federal marshal, who battles Mark for their custody. Soon Mark and Johnny are embroiled with the Dalton Gang and an effort by a female newspaper owner (Ann Richards) to make the territory part of Oklahoma.

While things don't go according to plan, Chavez's lover, Claudine (Mariana Hill), falls for Luke, which proves helpful to the scrappy bandits.

programme.desc: Marc Brissett teams up with Talent Da Comedian for hilarious standup comedy featuring Divine and Aldo Marachlian.

programme.title: Last ExMas
programme.desc: Ex-girlfriends Maggie and Julianne find themselves unexpectedly rekindling their spark during a hometown visit over the holidays.

programme.title: Almost Adults
programme.desc: In their last year of college, friends struggle to sustain their bond, as one’s emerging sexual identity and the other’s heartbreak pull them apart.

programme.title: Joey Coco Diaz: Sociably Unacceptable
programme.desc: It's been 25 years in the making and now Uncle Joey Diaz is at Seeso for his first socially unacceptable special. Prepare yourselves, savages.

programme.title: Zarna Garg: One in a Billion
programme.desc: Zarna, an Indian-Immigrant mom, has plenty to joke about.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Black Girl Panic
programme.desc: Jasmine Ellis reflects back at the formative experiences that formed her adulthood; to the delight of a full house in Austin, Texas, Ellis looks back at her parents, experiences in a mental hospital and interracial marriage as a Texan.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Weakness Is the Brand
programme.desc: Comedian Maria Bamford is back and subjectively better than ever! Weakness is her brand, so get ready to feel much better about yourself

programme.title: Maria Bamford: The Special Special Special
programme.desc: The comic performs for an audience consisting of only her parents.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Local Act
programme.desc: Beloved comedian and best-selling author Maria Bamford reveals the joy and sense of community of being an LA comic in this intimate stand-up special.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: Mahalo & Goodnight
programme.desc: In her fourth stand-up comedy special, Anjelah Johnson dishes on awkward massages, home invasions, spiders, and being a full-grown child.

programme.title: Tom Segura: Completely Normal
programme.desc: Radio, television and live performance veteran Tom Segura shares a few off-hand appraisals on hotels and hobbies with a cool and thoughtful demeanor.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we aren’t honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Gilbert Lawand: Iraqi Born, Georgia Bred
programme.desc: Gilbert Lawand is the American immigrant story whose father came to the US with only $35 his pocket and $4.5 million in stocks and bonds in the bank; can a boy from Iraq become a Southern gentleman?

programme.title: Nick Alexander Presents Nick Alexander
programme.desc: Nick Alexander marks his debut special, as he performs a coming-of-age set highlighting boyhood, his Haitian upbringing, relationships, depression, the pandemic, and everything in between while celebrating his birthday.

programme.title: Phil Kopczynski: Live at the Spokane Comedy Club
programme.desc: The risqué comic talks about being a young father of kids, breast pumps that nearly short-circuit the house, inappropriately titled sex toys and more.

programme.title: Nick Cannon: Stand-Up, Don't Shoot
programme.desc: Nick Cannon uses his potent voice to rip into society, love, dating and politics. Filmed live at the Ebony Repertory Theatre in South Central LA.

programme.title: J-L Cauvin: Half Blackface
programme.desc: Comedian J-L Cauvin hilariously addresses growing up the son of interracial parents and how the COVID-19 pandemic became his superhero origin story.

programme.title: Robert Mac: Back to Lake Titicaca
programme.desc: Comedian Robert Mac returns to the Dry Bar stage with less smartness, less subtleness, and even more silliness.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his life’s difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Bob Saget: Zero to Sixty
programme.desc: The popular stand-up declares himself to be the last TV father viewers can trust, as he shares funny words of wisdom and new, original comedy so

programme.title: Bob Saget: That’s What I’m Talkin’ About
programme.desc: Known for being family friendly, funnyman Bob Saget transforms into a foul-mouthed explainer and raconteur in this live stage show from Seattle.

programme.title: Tom Green Live
programme.desc: Following a similar format to a former online show that Tom Green hosted, "Tom Green Live" features the comic interviewing a guest from the entertainment world. Most of the hourlong episodes feature an interview with a single guest who gets grilled by Green and viewers, who are able to ask questions through video chat software. Each episode's initial broadcast airs live, allowing for a deeper look into the guest's life that might not be seen on other talk shows that edit interviews before they air. "Tom Green Live" also features less of a comedic atmosphere than his previous efforts.

programme.title: Steve Brown: Yeah, I Talk Like This
programme.desc: The high-pitched, high-energy voice of comedian Steve Brown is exactly how he talks in his first outrageous comedy set shot live in New York City.

programme.title: K-Von: Designer Muscles
programme.desc: Raised by a religious family in Las Vegas, half-Persian comedian K-von is an expert at removing a bad word from a joke while keeping it funny.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: I Could Eat - Part 1
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford is back and here to contemplate how "My 600 Pound Life" could go for 15 seasons and he was still underweight, the kind of racist you have to be to not take a free holiday, and explosive consequences in a Taco Bell bathroom.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The comic performs in St. Louis, discussing Christmas as a child, feeling guilty on Mother's Day, Thanksgiving and Disneyland.

programme.desc: "The Crawling Eye" (1958) Horror. With Forest Tucker, Laurence Payne.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Painted Hills" (1951) Adventure. A collie, played by Lassie, avenges its gold-miner master.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Daddy-O" (1959) Crime drama. Hoodlums want a singing truck driver to drive their getaway car. With Dick Contino, Sandra Giles, Bruno VeSota.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Counterintelligence takes on a new meaning in this barely coherent tale of Hawaiian espionage that takes place on movie sets meant to look like Hawaii.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Robot vs. the Aztec Mummy" (1959) Horror. Mad Dr. Krupp sends his homemade robot to rob the treasure of a Mexican mummy's tomb. With Ramon Gay, Rosita Arenas, Crox Alvarado.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Manos, Hands of Fate" (1966) Horror. A family driving through Texas asks a cult master for directions.

programme.desc: "Being From Another Planet."

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A boy tries to grow fuzzy aliens in his bedroom.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gorgo" (1961) Science Fiction. Monster wrecks London landmarks to free her baby.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Reviewing the 1966 film "The Bubble."

programme.desc: "The Lost Continent" (1951) Science fiction. Air Force pilots searching for a rocket crash-land on an island of dinosaurs. With Cesar Romero, Hillary Brooke, Chick Chandler.

programme.desc: "Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonder" (1996) Fantasy. A medieval wizard and his wife find trouble when they set up shop in the 20th century. With Ernest Borgnine, George Milan, Bunny Summers.

programme.desc: "The She Creature" (1956) Horror. A hypnotist (Chester Morris) brings out the beast in his helper (Marla English); with Tom Conway.

programme.desc: "Horror of Party Beach" (1964) Horror. Rockin' gilled monsters crash a beach bash; with John Scott; Alice Lyon.

programme.desc: "Hercules" (1959) Adventure. Greek muscleman (Steve Reeves) begins 12 labors, saves princess (Silva Koscina).

programme.desc: Emily's crew watch as the Doctor Mordrid defends Earth from the forces of evil, and Dr. Kabahl schemes to increase viewership.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.desc: This time you will see a new obstacle in 'The Qualifier', called 'Dodgeball Men.'

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks will party their way into the next team challenge when they leave the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR kitchen for the first time to cook at a birthday party for kids ages 8-13, as well as special guests, the Ramsay and Elliot children. The team that receives the most votes from the birthday party attendees will be safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next pressure test and create the French dessert croquembouche.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks squeeze in a seven-minute team challenge, in which they must make a batch of raspberry mint lemonade for judge Christina Tosi to blind taste test. Tosi will decide which team has the best lemonade and is safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next challenge, during which they must create a rad dish from a decade in which one of the judges was born.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Lido di Manhattan, an Italian joint with an unsightly kitchen and inexperienced owner. He is so horrified that he shuts the place down temporarily.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by a French eatery and discovers that he and the head chef have similar culinary training. However, the chef is in denial about the poor quality of his restaurant's food.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: After a lesson on the importance of teamwork in the kitchen, Chef Ramsay reveals that the chefs will be cooking five commonly served "staple" dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The final ten chefs are surprised when Gordon Ramsay brings in his daughter Tilly to celebrate her sweet sixteen.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Chef Paula Deen selects items for the mystery box challenge, which includes Southern staples and a surprise for the contestants.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Amateur chefs compete in cooking challenges overseen by a panel of accomplished chefs to survive elimination and become a culinary master, earning the title MasterChef.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough elimination challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks face their next task when the judges test their senses in a blind taste challenge. Each contestant will blindly taste a dish prepared by Gordon Ramsay and then must recreate the dish. The contestant with the dish that best reflects Gordon’s dish will receive a significant advantage. In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will prepare VIP dishes for a dining room of all grandmothers for their first restaurant challenge. Each team will create a unique dish of “new” ingredients and the team with the most votes will be safe from elimination. Find out who will move on to the Top 10 and who will leave.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Casa Roma in Lancaster, California. Although its bar is packed, Casa Roma's dining area is empty. The problems stem from the inexperienced owners managing a clueless staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Ramsay finds that the Mexican eatery Mama Rita's suffers from a disorganized kitchen. Meanwhile, the owner may have to sacrifice a friendship in order to save her business.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay challenges the nine remaining chefs to prepare authentic Chinese dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Both teams are down to four chefs each as the competition continues to heat up. The dining room gets an Italian transformation for one of the most anticipated challenges of the season: the blind taste test.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next mystery box challenge, the contestants must prepare a delicious and perfectly cooked T-bone steak dish. The home cook with the best dish earns immunity and assigns a different type of poultry to the remaining contestants in the elimination round. Later, pressure runs high as the competitors must cook the most important poultry dish and prove that they deserve to stay in the game. Find out which home cook flies the coop.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining six junior home cooks receive a special invitation to Gordon’s home for their next team challenge. Each team will prepare a two-course menu for a VIP lunch, including a seared red snapper appetizer and a roasted venison loin entrée. Later in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the judges will reveal which team received the best overall feedback on their dishes and had the most successful lunch service and which contestants will be in jeopardy of elimination. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who will go home and who will continue in the competition and compete in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Anna Vincenzo's, a family-run eatery in Boca Raton, Florida. He learns that the stubborn owner doesn't welcome change. After his ideas are ignored, Ramsay walks out.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Fleming, a Danish eatery in Miami. The stubborn owner doesn't want to update the place and Ramsay discovers something in the cooler that leads him to close the restaurant.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The competition heats up with only seven chefs left in the competition. During the challenge, guest judge and renowned pastry chef and chocolatier Valerie Gordon cracks down hard on both teams' takes on dessert.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Tension mounts when Chef Ramsay explains to the six remaining chefs that they will go through three extensive challenges to determine which five chefs receive a black jacket.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The judges get some very special help from their sons, who stop by the MASTERCHEF kitchen to judge the next mystery box challenge. Then, the contestants face the daunting task of recreating one of the greatest dishes the judges ever tasted. Later, in a field challenge, the remaining five home cooks visit a ranch where they will each prepare one Southern-inspired dish as part of a special summer luncheon for local charity volunteers. programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team present seasonal highlights from across the country, visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. At Longmeadow, Monty, Nigel and Nellie discuss the essential gardening jobs for this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty, Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow, providing inspiration for gardens and discussing all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of ideas of how to fill the weekend, from potting on seedlings to sowing tender vegetables. Rachel de Thame reviews the progress of her new kitchen garden and begins planting out peas and sowing flower seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plants out some tender plants, takes cuttings from herbs and sows carrots. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein goes back to the basics of propagating your own plants when she shows how to take cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Monty at Longmeadow for an indulgent, horticultural romp through the `Gardeners' World' archives and a joyous riot of colour as we celebrate some of our most beloved summer flowers. From Delphiniums to Clematis, Irises and Dahlias expert growers share their passion along with hints and tips. Carol Klein visits a garden in Worcestershire where she discovers picture perfect peonies.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to pot tomatoes on to the next stage of their growth. Adam Frost has ideas of transforming a part of his garden into a seating area using a few logs and plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds a variety of herbs that thrive in shade to the herb garden and adds summer annuals to the cottage garden. Nick Bailey has taken a rare opportunity to design his town garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out tender vegetables for late summer harvests and gives tips on plants that thrive on a minimum of water when he plants up a pot of succulent plants. Frances Tophill demonstrates an unusual method of reducing weeds in her allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on growing tomatoes and has ideas of how to fill gaps in the garden once the flowers of spring are past their best. The team meet an extraordinary gardener from Swansea, whose upper limb difference has not deterred her.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to prune spring-flowering roses and makes successional sowings of vegetables to ensure continuous crops. Adam Frost gives tips on helping plants cope with drought conditions and shows how to save precious water.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives tips on how to keep the garden looking good as well as how to maintain the vegetable plot for continuous crops. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein gives a comprehensive and seasonal guide to getting plants for free and this time she turns her attention to popular climbers like honeysuckle and clematis.

programme.desc: AMC Rebel Machine, Triumph Stag, and a Porsche race car

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Corvette powered VW Pickup and an Ed Roth Hot Rod
programme.desc: Corvette powered VW Pickup and an Ed Roth Hot Rod

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Jaguar E-Type, 1927 Chrysler, and a GTO parked for 40 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter comes across an all-original 1967 Jaguar E-Type and wide variety of MGs, along with a 1927 Chrysler 60 that's original down to the door knobs and electrical. Next up, a Pontiac GTO that has been parked for over 40 years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Liberace's gold Cadillac, rare BMW M5 Wagon, Mazda Cosmo and more
programme.desc: Liberace's gold Cadillac, rare BMW M5 Wagon, Mazda Cosmo and more

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rare glimpse inside Blake's Auto Salvage
programme.desc: Rare glimpse inside Blake's Auto Salvage.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Hot rods, Ardun heads, and a forgotten Morris Minor
programme.desc: Hot rods, Ardun heads, and a forgotten Morris Minor

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Modern Exotics Become Barn Finds? Exotic cars left in DUSTY disarray
programme.desc: While in Mississippi, Tom Cotter meets JD Pass and visits his unique collection.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Datsun, imported Ferrari, Swedish classics and a 289 Cobra name "Dirtbag"
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us a vast array of interesting barn finds from a low-mileage Datsun 510 to a imported Ferrari 400i. After finding a few Swedish classics in Michigan, Tom gets the story of how a 289 Cobra got the nickname, "Dirtbag."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Chevy-powered Jaguar E-Type and a Ford Bronco Driveway Find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets the details on a Jaguar E-Type with Chevy V-8 powertrain. Next, he heads south to discover a long-owned Ford Bronco that's been sitting in a man's driveway for quite some time.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE: Dan Gurney's Chevy Impala Returned to the Family After 63 Years
programme.desc: Tom and Justin Gurney unveil a long-lost 1961 Impala.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Ford Country Squire Wagon & Rust-free finds in Arizona

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Buick Grand National and a restoration shop disaster

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tom's Top 10 Barn Finds from the show

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ford GT40: GREATEST Barn Find Ever! All original & Hidden 43 Years
programme.desc: Tom visits with the new owner of a 1966 Ford GT40.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: The Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Gullwing Mercedes and the Maserati MC12

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole - The Rocketeer MX-V6 and new Renault 5 E-Tech
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the incredible Rocketeer MX-V6, a naturally aspirated, V-6 powered Mazda MX-5 Miata restomod. Next, Henry jumps in the new Renault 5 E-Tech: an affordable, fun EV for the masses?

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, Porsche Boxster

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Day 1 of the Thousand Islands Open on Lake Ontario and the St,. Lawrence River.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Final Day of the Thousand Islands Open on Lake Ontario and the St,. Lawrence River.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: This week, JP is joined by friend & guide Rob Jackson on the famed St. Lawrence River System.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Week 1 of the Tropic Star Inshore Seminars features guests targeting a plethora of species in the life rich waters surrounding the lodge.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a look into enhanced storage and utility options from Boat Outfitters like cooler slides, tackle storage and CoolerWebs . They also tackle applying Tuff-coat paint to the Aquasport project and showcase how easy it is to apply.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Missouri Project continues but this time it’s all about the turkey killing. Not only does Slade tag out in Missouri and Iowa, but a good family friend Kyle Hicks and Turkey Man Eddie Salter join in on a few hunts. Also, Slade does work on finding new 1031 tax properties and well as a little control burn.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins a local legend in the waters of Amelia Island, exploring its rich fishery and targeting redfish, trout, and more in this coastal gem.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins Capt. Ozzie in Captiva, FL where the action is fast and furious and they chase down an inshore slam in this beautiful Florida fishery.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons joins West Marine Advisor Eric Kufel in Sterling Alaska to explore the legendary Kenai River Peninsula.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons take the family to the Pink Shell Resort in Ft. Meyers Beach.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Kelli Campbell Goodnow honors the memory her husband…American hero Shawn Campbell.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: The team breaks down how, when, and where to create mock scrapes to attract and inventory mature bucks on your hunting property. From the science behind licking branches to choosing the perfect locations and using trail cameras to monitor activity, this episode is packed with practical tips that any hunter can use.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Phillip Culpepper is back, and he and the crew chase wild turkeys in the Sunshine State. Obviously, Spring Thunder is rolling in full force, and this week, we join the crew down south in Florida. Conditions are rough, but the guys stay after it and close the distance.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: With one farm flooded, the crew heads to northern Luisiana to try and punch a tag on a Louisiana Eastern. The boys get eyes on a group of birds and put them to roost. The next morning, they set up in hopes of catching them at fly down.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friends Capt. Tyler Webb and Capt. Casey Yaworski on a hunt for Sails in Islamorada, Florida.

programme.desc: In this episode we will dive the beautiful reefs and wrecks of Key Largo. We will showcase research that is being done in Key Largo to protect reefs worldwide.

programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how it’s done.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Everglades City Florida to meet up with local Capt. Jimmy Wheeler of the Everglades Fishing Company to get a taste of what the saying "Old Florida" really means. With the SeaVee 270Z bay boat in tow, the guys look to Jimmy to put them on the bite, fishing the shallow inshore wrecks and rock piles for Snook, Grouper, and Cobia.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Merritt Island, the sleepy space coast town where Ali was first introduced to fishing in Florida. Hoping to partake in a specialized fishery termed "fishing the other side," the guys will need calm weather, a serious boat, and a capable crew if they are going to have a shot at the yellowfin tuna that cruise the edge of the gulf stream current 100 plus miles off the coast.

It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Day 1 of the Thousand Islands Open on Lake Ontario and the St,. Lawrence River.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament

programme.desc: This week, JP is joined by friend & guide Rob Jackson on the famed St. Lawrence River System.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries

programme.title: Ship Shape TV

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: The team breaks down how, when, and where to create mock scrapes to attract and inventory mature bucks on your hunting property. From the science behind licking branches to choosing the perfect locations and using trail cameras to monitor activity, this episode is packed with practical tips that any hunter can use.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Phillip Culpepper is back, and he and the crew chase wild turkeys in the Sunshine State. Obviously, Spring Thunder is rolling in full force, and this week, we join the crew down south in Florida. Conditions are rough, but the guys stay after it and close the distance.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: With one farm flooded, the crew heads to northern Luisiana to try and punch a tag on a Louisiana Eastern. The boys get eyes on a group of birds and put them to roost. The next morning, they set up in hopes of catching them at fly down.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Merritt Island, the sleepy space coast town where Ali was first introduced to fishing in Florida. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

They stay at a hotel, where, despite the reticence of owner Madame Zisi (Danielle Darrieux), they are befriended by her lover, Eliot (Kenneth More). Joss (Susannah York), the eldest of the children, runs afoul of Madame Zisi, who thinks Eliot is spending too much time with her and causes a scene. Robbed of Eliot's attention, Joss denounces him to the police.

programme.title: The Palomino
